intro: Cephaelis barcellana, commonly known as the pink fairy fan, is a flowering plant native to the Andes mountains of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its delicate, pink or white flowers that bloom in clusters, often resembling small fans. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs. Cephaelis barcellana thrives in cool, humid environments and is often found in high-altitude regions.
